Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Move code generators to SDK" (#1129) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Opened issue "error if backslashes in zip path" (#1128) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Description**

When reading an OpenXml file that uses backslashes (instead of forward slashes) in the Zip paths: 
then OpenXml will not open the file and will throw an error
```
  The specified package is invalid. The main part is missing.
   at DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Packaging.OpenXmlPackage.Load(Package package)
```
_Open XML SDK 2.5 Productivity Tool_
gives this message: "Cannot open the file: The specified file type is not supported."

The Zip spec says forward slash "should" be used.
Almost everything (Office, Explorer, 7-Zip, SharpZipLib) handles and normalizes the slashes.
(System.IO.Packaging.ZipPackage and LibreOffice do not)

**Information**

- .NET Framework 4.7.2
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml 2.15.0

**Repro**

Xslx file is generated by a 3rd party app. (is a dotNet app, but I don't know what they're using to generate the file)
Problem reading can be observed with System.IO.Packaging.ZipPackage

```csharp
var package = System.IO.Packaging.ZipPackage.Open(file);
var parts = package.GetParts(); //< returns null for the bad backslash file
``` 

[Zip-Ada](https://sourceforge.net/projects/unzip-ada/) shows the real slashes
```
 xl/sharedStrings.xml
 docProps/core.xml
 docProps/app.xml
~~~~~
 xl\sharedStrings.xml
 docProps\core.xml
 docProps\app.xml
```

[slash.xlsx](https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK/files/8093343/slash.xlsx)
[backslash.xlsx](https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK/files/8093342/backslash.xlsx)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Convert source generators to incremental generators" (#1127) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Merged pull request "OpenXmlPart: added UnloadRootElement method" (#1126) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Closed issue "SlidePart.Slide: how to unload memory" (#1122) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,
I'm reading large pptx files slide-by-slide with limited RAM (azure functions), so after using SlidePart.Slide property the slide is loaded into memory and will be unloaded only when the pptx will be unloaded which means that memory consumption is growing with every slide.

For now I'm using internal `OpenXmlPart.SetPartRootElementToNull()` via reflection to release the memory. 
https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK/blob/8a29bec8be9221e6b2eefb962f41b95b8391a773/src/DocumentFormat.OpenXml/Packaging/OpenXmlPart.cs#L608

Is there an official way to unload memory when it's not needed anymore? Or maybe it's possible to mark this method as public?

Thanks.

_Originally posted by @f1nzer in https://github.com/OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK/discussions/1121_
